messages.title: A record of delivery for Horsell West
messages.content: Ann-Marie Barker has campaigned to remove the council pay stations in Queen Elizabeth Gardens. Ann-Marie Barker led the fight in the Council Chamber to get a lower accessible bridge over the canal to the car park and WWF.

housing.content: Horsell's successful new allotment site came from Ann-Marie's request to review allotment provision in Woking which highlighted the need for more allotment space.

politicalExperience.achievements: Campaign to remove the council pay stations in Queen Elizabeth Gardens. Led the fight in the Council Chamber to get a lower accessible bridge over the canal to the car park and WWF.

quotes.text: Chris is a dedicated and passionate local campaigner. He is enthusiastic about the area and you can count on him to work hard for Horsell [throughout] the year.
Chris is a tireless campaigner. His enthusiasm is infectious and he would, I am sure, be an excellent MP.
quotes.source: Ed Davey Energy and Climate Change Secretary

images.caption: Ann-Marie Barker and Parliamentary Candidate Chris Took in front of Horsell Common sign.
Ann-Marie Barker in front of Queen Elizabeth Gardens.
Chris Took standing outside with a building in the background.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Elect a good Lib Dem MP and a hardworking local Councillor for Horsell West on May 7th this year.
